result.execSummary:
The defendant Emmit Layfette Groce Jr was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Burglary-Building or Dwelling, a class F felony, Wisconsin Statutes 943.10(1m)(a).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes:
The Court ordered the defendant to provide a DNA sample and pay surcharge and
pay all applicable costs, fees & surcharges to be paid through collection by the DOC from 25% of funds under Sec. 973.05(4)(b) and as a condition of Extended Supervision.
Any unpaid balance is to be converted to a civil judgment.

Defendant's pro se petition to modify payment obligations.
Original Transcript PLEA & SENTENCING HEARING  (13 pages) commencing MAY 13, 2014 received and filed.

Defendant Emmit Layfette Groce in court with attorney Richard J Johnson.  Defendant Emmit Layfette Groce in custody.  Tyrone M St Junior appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant was advised of constitutional rights and maximum penalties, waived all rights, plead GUILTY and was examined as to the plea.  Plea Questionnaire/Waiver of Rights and Addendum received and filed.  Parties stipulate to the complaint as a factual basis for the plea.  Court found defendant guilty as charged in the Information and ordered entry of Judgment of Conviction.
Statements made as to sentencing.
The Court sentenced the defendant to a MAXIMUM TERM OF IMPRISONMENT of 5 YEARS,  with credit for 55 dats time served; the INITIAL TERM OF CONFINEMENT in the Wisconsin State Prison System is 3 years; the MAXIMUM TERM OF EXTENDED SUPERVISION is 2 years.  The defendant is not eligible for the Challenge Incarceration Program or the Wisconsin Substance Abuse Program.  
Terms of extended supervision:
-No new law violations rising to the level of probable cause
-Cooperate with the Department
-Possess no weapons
-AODA assessment and cooperate with any treatment
-Maintain absolute sobriety with random urine screens
-No contact with 728 North Milwaukee Street or Marc B and Marta B
-Seek and maintain full time employment
-Obtain HSED or GED
Restitution set at zero
The court ordered defendant provide DNA sample--pay surcharge through collection by the Department of Corrections from 25% of funds under Sec. 973.05(4)(b) and as a condition of extended supervision; any balance remaining unpaid at that time is to be converted to a civil judgment against the defendant    
The Court ordered all applicable costs, fees and surcharges to be paid through collection by the Department of Corrections from 25% of funds under Sec. 973.05(4)(b) and as a condition of extended supervision; any balance remaining unpaid at that time is to be converted to a civil judgment against the defendant    

Pursuant to Wisconsin Statutes section 973.176, the Court advised the defendant of the following restrictions:  Firearm possession; Voting 

Filed:
Ineligible Voting Notice & Acknowledgement;
Notice of Right to Seek Postconviction Relief.  kmw

Defendant Emmit Layfette Groce in court with attorney Richard J Johnson.  Defendant Emmit Layfette Groce in custody.  Lucy J Kronforst appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant was advised of constitutional rights and maximum penalties, waived all rights, plead guilty and was examined as to the plea.  During the court's questioning, court orders plea vacated and case adjourned.  Plea and Sentencing hearing scheduled for May 13, 2014 at 08:30 am.

Defendant Emmit Layfette Groce in court with attorney Allison M Ritter.  Tyrone St. Junior for Lucy J Kronforst appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Atty Ritter new on the case and awaiting all discovery.  Status conference scheduled for June 3, 2014 at 08:30 am.

Attorney Deb Patterson for Richard J Johnson in court, defendant Emmit Layfette Groce not in court, in custody.  Lucy J Kronforst appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Plea hearing scheduled for May 12, 2014 at 08:30 am.

Attorney Richard J Johnson in court, defendant Emmit Layfette Groce not in court, in custody.  Lucy J Kronforst appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Plea hearing scheduled for May 7, 2014 at 08:30 am.
Bail motion by defense argued and denied by the Court.

Defendant Emmit Layfette Groce in court with attorney Richard J. Johnson.  Defendant Emmit Layfette Groce in custody.  Tim Cotter for Lucy J. Kronforst appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant waived Preliminary Hearing.  Preliminary Hearing Questionnaire and Waiver received and filed. Court found probable cause and bound defendant over for trial.  Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge Yamahiro, Branch 34.  Original Information filed.  Copy given to defense counsel who waived reading.  Defendant pleads not guilty.  Scheduling conference scheduled for April 16, 2014 at 08:30 am.

Signed and filed, No Contact Order.  Defendant to have no contact with CUBANITAS, 728 N. MILWAUKEE ST.
  Court advised defendant that failure to comply with conditions of bail may result in an additional charge of bail jumping.
Court orders defendant TURNED OVER to JUSTICE Point for Supervision.  ABSOLUTE SOBRIETY  to be monitored by drug testing and portable breathalyzers.

Defendant Emmit Layfette Groce in court with attorney Mary Garvin Guimont.  Defendant Emmit Layfette Groce in custody.  Hanna R. Kolberg appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy court clerk:  hgj.  Defendant given a copy of complaint and advised of maximum penalties, right to counsel and right to a preliminary hearing.  Court reviewed complaint and found probable cause to hold defendant for further proceedings.  DEFENDANT IS INDIGENT AND PUBLIC DEFENDER WILL PROVIDE COUNSEL.  Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge YAMAHIRO, Branch 34.  Case is adjourned for preliminary hearing in Branch PE.  Preliminary hearing scheduled for April 4, 2014 at 08:30 am.
Defendant in Custody, Court appearance today in Intake Court, Room 137A.
